definition: to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate

sentences.english: This is the second state visit to France by President Hu Jintao in the six years.
sentences.chinese: 这是时隔6年多后，胡锦涛再次对法国进行国事访问。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister is on a three-day state visit to the US.
sentences.chinese: 目前，莫迪总理正在对美国进行为期三天的国事访问。

sentences.english: So the Estonian side is very glad at President Jiang's state visit to Estonia.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我们非常高兴江主席来爱沙尼亚进行国事访问。

sentences.english: Recently, Than Shwe concluded a five-day state visit to China.
sentences.chinese: 最近，丹瑞结束对中国为期五天的国事访问。

sentences.english: We are also busily preparing the state visit by Indian President to China.
sentences.chinese: 我们也在积极筹备印度总统对中国的国事访问。

sentences.english: President Hu had a successful state visit to the United States in January.
sentences.chinese: 胡主席在一月份对美国进行了一次成功的国事访问。

sentences.english: This week, President Obama makes his first state visit to China.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马总统即将在本周对中国进行首次国事访问。

sentences.english: It was the first state visit in English history.
sentences.chinese: 这是英格兰历史上的首次国事访问。

sentences.english: This is the first state visit to Kenya by President Hu.
sentences.chinese: 这是胡锦涛主席首次对肯尼亚进行国事访问。

sentences.english: Cosgrove has been in China since last week on his first state visit.
sentences.chinese: 上周，科斯格罗夫来华进行首次国事访问。

sentences.english: This state visit will be the first of the Obama administration.
sentences.chinese: 这将是奥巴马政府接待的第一个国事访问。

sentences.english: It is the starting point for state visits complete with red carpets and marching bands.
sentences.chinese: 作为国事访问的“序章”，它配有红地毯和军乐队。

sentences.english: U.S. Vice President Joe Biden has wrapped up his six-day official visit to China.
sentences.chinese: 美国副总统拜登已经结束对中国为期六天的国事访问。

sentences.english: President Hu paid a state visit to France last time 6 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这是时隔6年多后，胡锦涛再次对法国进行国事访问。

definition: to go and visit in an official capacity or for investigation
summit talks/discussion between heads of state
Yang Jiechi (1950-), Chinese politician and diplomat, foreign minister of PRC 2007-2013
Moon Jae-in (1953-), Korean politician and human rights lawyer, president of Korea from 2017
foreign minister/secretary of state/minister of foreign affairs
to meet with (sb who is paying a visit)/CL:次[ci4]
